column7: ['• Business trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Single Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Quality and Quantity of breakfast not good. Guy preparing omelettes not polite.
column9: Excellent location. MRT station just across the road. Reception team very polite and kind. Anwar from the reception team very nice and helpful guy.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Standard Triple Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: THE STAFF TOLD ME I WAS OVER CHARGED BY BOOKING.COM. DOUBLE THE COST OF THE ROOM.ROOM WAS VERY SMALL, NO WIFI IN THE ROOM. NO CONNECTIONS FOR CHARGING THE PHONE. COMPARED TO PRICE I PAID AND WALK IN CUSTOMERS I WAS OVER CHARGED.WHEN I ASKED HIM HE SAID ITS MY FAULT I BOOKED WITH BOOKING.COM. THERE WAS A DANCING CLUB JUST OUTSIDE THE HOTEL WE COULD HEAR A LOT OF CHATTERING AND NOISE OUTSIDE. VERY VERY UNHAPPY.  They did not offer to return my deposit when checking out. We had to ask for it. At first I could not find my receipt and he refuse to return my deposit. VERY DISAPPOINTED. THE GUY WAS VERY RUDE. DO NOT ADVISE TO STAY AT THIS FACILITY.😱

column6: “Location was very near to Rochor MRT.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• People with friends', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Aircond was too cold despite adjusting the temperature. Breakfast variety lacking but sufficient. No toothbrush or shampoo provided - only soap and body wash
column9: Location was very near to Rochor MRT. Lots of halal restaurant around the area, including a halal mamak restaurant that is 24 hours just next door. Breakfast was muslim friendly too

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8: The first room we were given which had two small windows - one at the bottom of the wall and one at the top - neither of which could be opened and no view at all.  If there had been a fire there was little chance of escaping from the hotel.  We also had to use the goods lift to the floors as no passenger lift was available.
column9: The breakfast was poor -either eggs/noodles, eggs/bake beans/, eggs/fried rice

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Very compact room with only a small desk and one chair. The bathroom was back the front and it wasn't made clear to us that if we wanted a hot shower we had to actually turn the water heater on. So the first night there was a cold shower!! A big problem is that taxi drivers don't seem to know how to get to this hotel,  even if we show them the small map the the hotel provides.
column9: The breakfast was tasty and plenty of it, but not a huge selection, bit still hapy with the value of breakfast.

column6: “Best of this hotel is the location near to MRT Rocher station”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Standard Triple Room', '• Stayed 5 nights']
column8: Some display of fresh fruits , some croissants , muffins, variety in eggs , hash brown potatoes , some grilled or sauteed vegetables , sausages
column9: Breakfast was not upto the mark , they should have more variety , only bread (white & brown) with Jam & Butter , tea coffee and one more dish only , no other choice ... who eats fried rice in the breakfast or rather noodles.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• Superior Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 2 nights']
column8: Elevator - one very different and bit not comfortable
column9: Breakfast was very basic. Just bread, egg omelet, kidney beans, tea/coffee. Nothing for vegetarians. No selection.

column7: ['• Business trip', '• Family with young children', '• 2 rooms', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Noise from the street (probably the mamak’s stall). Small shower. Very poor WiFi in the room.
column9: Location was great near Rochor MRT station. Sufficient breakfast (different menu everyday). Nice coffee. Micheal was very friendly and he’s a great help there.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Single Room', '• Stayed 1 night']
column8: The room was quite noisy because there was an air conditioning outlet on the other side of the corridor, which was clearly audible from inside the bedroom.
column9: The room was very clean and the location of the hotel was convenient for getting around Singapore. The breakfast (included in the price) was very good, with freshly fried eggs and a selection of cold items. I didn't spend much time in the hotel but the staff were friendly to me. Good value for money.

column6: “Property is very good in cleaning, very good location for...”

column8: Breakfast menu can be improved
column9:
Property is very good in cleaning, very good location for shopping and travelling by train.
All staffs were friendly and helpful.
Breakfast making chef is very friendly 
I will recommend this hotel

column6: “I choose to stay at Perak hotel because of its close proximity to Little India and Bugis district.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 2 nights']
column9: The breakfast was good and didn't expect the hotel staff to call and remind me to have breakfast. The Rochor MRT station is right beside the hotel, very convenience for me to travel by train.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']

One staff was not at all accommodating BUT THE REST OF THE STAFF WERE NICE.
He did not honor previous arrangement that caused my daughter great inconvenience.
column9: Location!

column6: “It was an okay experience... Regret that we could spent more to have a better experience...”
column7: ['• Business trip', '• People with friends', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
1)While doing early checkout, we were in a rush so handed over key and left luggage in store room. Before leaving we checked everything was fine. Upon taking luggage back they claimed we broke wooden frame of small mirror, which we did not used at all. After so much argument they charged 68 SGD instead of 150 SGD. That was something shocking but we had to pay because they locked our luggage and asked us to pay first and then take back our luggage 
2)Breakfast was simple and ok
3)Location... In terms of bars were nearby which may not be good for families having minor childrens esp girls.. Indian people were sleeping on roads, ppl were drinking on road side of bars..
4)They claimed that online booking websites charged more than booking from their website
5)Wifi wasn't available in room
6)even there wasnt any complimentary water
column9:
Location only in terms of 
- Nearby indian restaurants
- walking distance to mustafa
-walking distance to 7-ELEVEN 
... But we cud get better if we spent more SGD

column6: “Basic place. Nothing special but excellent location for Little India.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Small room, old facilities and pretty basic accommodation on the whole.
column9: Location was great, right near Rochor station in Little India. A/C was good.

column6: “Nice friendly hotel in a quiet street on the edge of Little...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column9: Nice friendly hotel in a quiet street on the edge of Little India and right next door to Rochas MRT Station. An excellent base for our travels. We really enjoyed our stay here.

column7: ['• Business trip', '• Couple', '• 2 rooms', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: It stated that wifi was included but when we got there they said “its not guaranteed”. I didnt have any roaming services so that was a lil bit of a bummer. Had to go to the lobby to make calls.

column6: “Quiet boutique hotel with old world charm and attentive service.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 1 night']
column8: The breakfast was included but was not much of one. They ran out of the set menu and so we did get made to order eggs. But toast, canned fruit and mediocre coffee was our only accompaniment. For being in Singapore where they make some of the best coffee in the world, we were a bit disappointed.
column9: The boutique charm and historical feel was a nice change from a chain hotel. It was a very convenient location right next to a Subway line. The staff was friendly and held our luggage for us after we checked out so that we could go to the museum before our late night flight. The Little India neighborhood had lots of good food options.

column6: “Old Singaporian style accommodation with helpful staff and very conveniently situated.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8: We were very happy with our stay.  No complaints
column9: Simple but good selection at breakfast,  Good location for walking to various places and excellent for the MRT at the top of the road.

column6: “It felt like someone’s home as well as a hotel.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Superior Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: There is a noisy club a few doors down which plays music all night which we were unaware
column9: It felt like someone’s home as well as a hotel. The furnishing were dated in a way which suited the hotel

column6: “Perfect location, only few steps from Rochor MRT.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Standard Triple Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: More variation of breakfast will be appreciated. The lift is so old that I choose to use stairs.
column9: Perfect location, only few steps from Rochor MRT. Clean room and bathroom. The staffs are nice and they let us store our luggage there after check out.

column6: “Great staff and close to all the attractions of Little India and the metro.”
column7: ['• Solo traveller', '• Standard Single Room', '• Stayed 2 nights']
column8:
The shower was a bit of a hassle. It was small and the door seemed to stick.
Wifi only really works in the lobby.
column9:
The staff are wonderful, so hospitable and helpful. I've stayed in a lot of places and this is the only one that takes you to your room, shows you how to switch things on, helps with the luggage, etc. They had conversion plugs, maps for Little India, recommended places to go, where the ATM was, the metro. I found all of them willing to help at a moment's notice.
The bed was comfortable.
I enjoyed being in a part of Singapore that didn't feel fake.
A convenient spot for food, the metro, drinks, shopping.

column6: “Great character hotel in Little India, if you want something that isn't a bland high rise.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Superior Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8:
It was a little noisy at night, from external music coming from somewhere, but the aircon mostly disguised this. Did not disrupt sleep.
Limited breakfast choice. Unfortunately did not provide an option that either myself or daughter liked, so we ate out. But it was well presented - more about our personal choices really.
column9: Loved the hotel style and obvious history with the area.

column6: “Simple, clean and right in the middle of Little Indian.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column9: Simple, clean and right in the middle of Little Indian.  Basic hotel with extremely helpful staff.  Great value for money. Excellent fir back packers.

column6: “Staff is very kind and they assist me very much since it was...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Single Room', '• Stayed 7 nights']
column9: Staff is very kind and they assist me very much since it was my firt visit singapore. I am 18 yeaes old and just graduated form high school. This is my first journey to go aborad alone.  So I feel a bit nervous but I enjoyed singapore stay very much! Thank you PERAK HOTEL !

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Room, particularly the bathroom, was small. A/C permanently on - too cold in the room.  Noise until 3 a.m. from adjacent music venue. Breakfast not available until 7.30. I had to leave at 6.30 a.m.
column9: Location, cleanliness, comfortable bed

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
Old furnitures and noise of compressor(they made our room changes for this after one night ) and also a strange noise from electric box in my room( we didn’t notice this to hotel)
Too Poor wifi in the room ..
column9:
Location and cleanliness. mrt is in 100meter 
Super clean in everywhere .. we love this ...
Stuffs are so co operative and friendly ...

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Single Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: The wifi was a bit of a pain as in it worked fine but not if your room is on the ground floor. Can't use it in my bedroom so had to go to reception or restaurant. There were 4 different log in areas with different passwords for each, so be careful which part of the hotel you're in As you will need to log in each time. That's my only critism really.
column9:
Nice hotel on the edge of little india. A 2 minute walk to Rocher MRT station. The MRT is the best way to get all over the city and very quick.
Hotel was nice and had character to it. The breakfast choice changed daily which was great and plenty of it.

column6: “Not too good. Not very bad. Just ok.”

column6: “Great location - right next to Rochor MRT and a good base to...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 4 nights']
column8: Nothing!
column9: Great location - right next to Rochor MRT and a good base to explore Little India from. Really friendly, helpful staff. Our room was nice & cosy and the hotel had character & charm. Breakfast was basic but adequate - with a different hot dish cooked fresh each morning.

column6: “overall good stay will like to come here again, the location is best part of the property”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• 2 rooms', '• Stayed 6 nights']
column8: There were small ants in the room i believe this is due to the fact it is a very old property and is located in a tropical country
column9: The 3 bed room is nice but it has no place to walk as it is on a platform. the room though is nice and is a different feel to it.

column6: “We enjoyed our stay at the Perak as have not stayed in this area previously & would return.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8: Few more tv channels perhaps.
column9: Room was adequate size.  We had a very 'open mind' with our stay at the Perak & took into account that it is indeed a heritage building. Very convenient to the local Rochor MRT just up the road, good variety of restaurants around the area.  Staff were very friendly & helpful. Room very clean.  Walking distance to Kampong Glam area.

column6: “Location was great, very close to MRT and bus stations ”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Single Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: 2-3 staff behaviors were not pleasant. Single beds are very narrow, not comfortable for a person to sleep comfortably
column9: Location was great, very close to MRT and bus stations

column6: “We chose to go back again on our way home- that says it all!”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Superior Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8: The wifi is patchy - there are several different passwords for different areas within the building and it is rather slow.
column9: We liked the fact that this hotel is an authentic "Little India" experience, not a new, modern, characterless building. Also the staff were very helpful, the bed and pillows were very comfortable.

column6: “The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Single Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: The wifi connection is quite poor. The lobby area had a better connection but it isn’t practical to be out in the lobby when you’ve booked a room and want to be in it!
column9: The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant.

column7: ['• Business trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Single Room', '• Stayed 4 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Nothing could have been.improved.
column9: No croissants. But not a problem. Very.impressed with knowledgeable, accommodating and friendly staff.  Housekeeping deserves special.praise. staff all went the extra mile. The ambiance.was on spot. A heritage sight. Clean. Clean. Clean. Spec thanks to Mrs. GEN MANAGER who.was extremely helpful. I'll be back.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• Standard Triple Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column9: Best feature is the location of the hotel. Very close to Rochor MRT station and Little India MRT staion. The room fits us comfortably (there were 3 of us the first two nights and then 4 of us). The bathroom is clean and hot water is working. That is all we need as we leave in the morning and return at night to sleep. Breakfast is provided but next door is an halal eating place that is open 24 hours so we always have options. The staffs were very helpful. Will definitely return to Perak Hotel.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• 2 rooms', '• Stayed 1 night']
column8: Breakfast - possibly one of the worst hotel breakfasts I've ever been offered. There are dozens of better options outside the hotel door in any direction!
column9: Terrific location for Little India and access to museums and galleries. Lovely to stay in such a beautifully maintained colonial building. Very friendly and helpful staff.

column6: “Little india is full of colour and flavour.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: You can't open the window. No fridge in the room. A bit of noise during the night because of the a/c and bars nearby, not a big problem.
column9: Little india is full of colour and flavour. The hotel is near the metro station. Breakfast is almost the same everyday but is OK. They can provide you an adaptor to charge your devices.

column6: “Easy access and convenience. Less of room comfort.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Standard Triple Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: No Wi-Fi coverage in room. Only one plug point for our charging in a 3 bed room.
column9: Near to rochor MRT station and jalan besar MRT. Most nearby Indian restaurant.

column6: “The usual happy greeting and kind consideration from everyone.”
column7: ['• Solo traveller', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 1 night']
column8: Nothing. Have stayed here before, that is why I returned. Very kind managers and staff.
column9: No croissants, bed fine. The refurburations since my last stay are good and the lift a wonderful addition to the upstairs area access.

column6: “Best little place to stay if visiting Singapore”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Single Room', '• Stayed 5 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Single Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: I requested a double bed and got a single and the clerk was rude by saying you can leave but you will not get your money back.
column9: Everything was fine not great but it’s the value you pay.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 2 nights']
column8:
This Hotel is an older, traditional establishments, Its not glamorous or plush, If you are after those qualities don't come to the Perak Hotel. However if you are looking for a traditional Hotel, friendly staff, lovely homely surroundings,
then you will not be disappointed
column9:
Location was great, in the heart of little India, less than a minute from the train station. The Arab quarter is not far.
This is really the old Singapore the I visited in the 80's 
Staff are very helpful.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Superior Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 4 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Wifi in rooms was intermittent but no problem in reception area.  Not a deal breaker.
column9: Clean rooms, plenty of places to visit in area and close to MRT to get around rest of city, just at the end of the street.  Fresh and tasty breakfast.  Staff helpfull and friendly.

column6: “Good for a brief stay in Singapore.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Single Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: The room was small and had no window. There was also some noisy plumbing constantly in the background which was annoying.
column9: The staff were all friendly and the location conveniently close to a MRT station. The breakfast was good and the room was clean with a kettle and tea/coffee provided.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Single Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']

column9: Wonderful location for exploring, quiet. Close to MRT. Helpful staff.

Unable to connect wifi in the room at all even password had been provided.

It will be good if mineral water bottles are free of charge as these are quite basic and should not be included in the mini bar.
column9:
Location of the hotel is super near to Rochor MRT Station.
 
Orientation of the room during check in by the friendly staffs. 
Breakfast is fine.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Everything during the stay was excellent; no more, no less than expected.
column9: Convenient location, helpful staff; modest but good enough living conditions; not a place to enjoy a romantic get away; but a cheap and cosy enough place to rest before/ after intense sightseeing.

column6: “The room was too small requested two single beds and was...”

column8:
The room was too small requested two single beds and was informed they only have doubles.
The bathroom could have been a lot cleaner.
Requested extra blankets was informed there aren’t any.
The shower was luke warm and was not informed how to turn the water meter on and had a cold shower the first night which made me ill.
The hotel staff were rude continued to remind us of our check out time.
The only good thing was the location was excellent on the door step to a mrt station.

column8: Internet accessibility would have been nice in the rooms... but i get that refurbished old buildings (maybe) will have difficulty catering to that.... maybe....
column9: I like that its near the mrt station, there is access to busses within walking distance, and since it is in Little India, access to food.... there is also a laundry place right in front, and a small convenience store as well, even 7E is within walking distance....

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Standard Triple Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8: The breakfast spread. Didn't have anything for vegetarians.
column9: Everything was great except that we did not quite liked the breakfast spread as we are vegetarians. However, Little India is a place where a vegetarian would be spoilt for choice.

column6: “A great place in the centre of Little India.”
column7: ['• Business trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 1 night']
column8: Nothing
column9: Perak hotel is real close to Rochor MRT, just a mere 20 mtrs away, so location is great! The wifi is free and works fine, they have both wifi and LAN internet in the room, and both worked excellent. The bed was comfy, the room was clean and tidy and spacious enough for a couple. The staff were very courteous and friendly. They offer you a refreshment when you arrive, the room comes with free breakfast (although I did not try that, since I had already plans for bkfast). All in all great value for the money, and a very pleasant stay.

column6: “Noisy and Not worth the Money you pay for it”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Single Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: The room was in the Basement, smelled of cleaning fluids and i could Not Open the window. Which was worse was that it was very loud. You can hear the fridge in your room, People above you walking and some pipes run by the room which are super noisy and woke me Up every half Hour. The rooms upstairs might be nicer but Mine was not worth the Money
column9: Good Location and they let me in the room early

column7: ['• Business trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: The walls and ceilings are very thin and there was a ton of noise from inside the hotel and across the street. No ones fault in an otherwise nice experience.
column9: Staff, location, cleanliness and price.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 1 night']
column8: The bathroom was not as clean as I had hoped. Also, there was a lot of noise at night...the drawback of being in a happening part of the city.
column9: This was my second time staying at the Perak Hotel. It's in a great location in the midst of Little India and within walking distance to the MRT. Staff was friendly. Good breakfast with eggs, toast, fruit, cereal, etc. Also, the hotel recently installed a lift, which makes getting luggage to the room a lot easier.

column6: “DO NOT book this hotel! The worst choice for a holiday in Singapore!”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Single Room', '• Stayed 4 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Bad and unwilling personal to help clients. Even very naughty! Very poor breakfast, prepared and served in a dirty and totally inappropriate area! The rooms shown on the booking.com site are not the ones you check out! Those are just presentation pictures. Reality is another and very bad! If you do not want to spoil your vacation in Singapore then do not book this hotel!
column9:
This hotel is not 3 * At most 1 * The rooms are dirty, unpretentious, bad smell, mold, spiders, cockroaches in the bathroom. 
The rooms do not have windows and the air conditioning works very badly. I do not recommend! I had to change the hotel after the first night. Of course, the money on other nights paid was not refunded to me!

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column9: Very friendly staff. The hotel is at a great location. 100 meters from Rochor MRT station and 5 minutes walk from Little India MRT station. Plenty of restaurants and cafes around.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 1 night']
column8: The issue was I didn't sleep a wink all night due to noise blaring out of a nearby bar/club. It went on to about 4.00am. Perhaps it was due to it being Saturday night.
column9: Location was great. Just a few metres from a MTR station. It's near some cheap and tasty eateries. Friendly staff. Easy check-in and out.

column6: “Basic hotel but fine for a short stay”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Single Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: The room and bathroom could have been properly cleaned, my rooms bathroom opened above the windows to outside and some generators there meant continual low humming noises but I still sleep ok. Breakfast very basic, I would prefer a cleaner place without inclusive breakfast for this price.
column9: Basic hotel as expected but staff were helpful, I was only there one night between flights and had everything required. Nothing really stood out but all fine.

column6: “Great location, but you can hear everything from your room”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Single Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8: Noisy all the day and night. You can hear how people talk in other rooms, how they walking, etc.
column9: Great location: 1 minute walk to the MTR. Breakfast is ok.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Single Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Old fashioned. It reminds me of a 70s British b&b. It's like Singapore full of rules and regulations. I travelled solo and I wasn't allowed to receive a friends visit. It's not sound proof so you can even hear people in the toilet. Breakfast was served as a complimentary but you still expect some kind of quality and formality... anyone in the hotel would serve breakfast the maid the receptionist or the office person....
column9: It is close to the metro station. It is in Little India.

column6: “I liked the size of the hotel - small, and the location...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Single Room', '• Stayed 11 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Even though the place looked tired and was needing a paint job especially in the bedroom, it was very good value.
column9: I liked the size of the hotel - small, and the location which was not in the heart of busy Little India but the outskirts where it was quieter but close (2min walk) to an MRT station.  Most of all the  friendliness of the place. Michael was especially helpful and kind. Breakfast was adequate.

the breakast (vegetables missing and fruits too...)

column9: the kindnest and quality of hosts, the location close to Rochor MRT.

column6: “For Singapore this is a good value  hotel with friendly...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Single Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column9: For Singapore this is a good value  hotel with friendly staff and breakfast. WiFi is patchy but worked ok in my room. Ceilings are thin so you may be lucky or unlucky with noise but I had no problems. Would stay again. Hotel is right next to metro on doorstep of Little India.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 4 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']

column9: Milo and warm milk for kids. Kids friendly breakfast with less spice. Kind and helpful staff.

column7: ['• Business trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Single Room', '• Stayed 4 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: None.
column9: Everything. I love the staffs, location, environment. Basically, this is my 2nd trip to this hotel. And I would love to stay here again and again! The hotel even upgraded my room, and I was really surprised! Thank you Perak Hotel! Also, the staffs were very helpful and friendly, and I felt like home :)

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: The fact that you can't look out of your room and that is a bit suffocating.
column9:
Two problems. The Windows have been blacked out and so you can't look out from any room . There is a window high up in the room, but the normal window has been painted over and cannot be opened. So no fresh air. Secondly wifi in the rooms does not function well.
Otherwise very nice staff and very good value for money. Metro station very close by and that was excellent. Very honest, courteous and friendly staff. Excellent service. We are gong back for the final leg of our trip.

column6: “Comfortable hotel, easy to reach, friendly staff”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Superior Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column9: Friendly and helpful staff. Clean rooms. Comfortable. Breakfast included. Overall we had a very good stay in the superior room. Close bij MRT, shopping, bus. Good atmosphere.

column6: “All in all a pleasant stay but could do with a few improvements.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Breakfast could be improved.. poor selection of food. Bathroom needs to be upgraded.. a bit worn out and it would be good if more toiletries were offered. Toilet flush was weak. Needed to flush toilet at least three times every time. There was some construction work going on outside my window on Sat morning that woke me up early, a bit of an inconvenience.
column9: Bed was comfy and room was clean. WiFi worked ok. Front office staff were helpful and pleasant. Location of hotel is close to MRT , very convenient

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Standard Single Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']

column8: The room was shabby.  The bathroom was grubby, mould around the shower seals, limescale around the tap,  a waste pipe within the shower cubicle, tile grout was almost black with mould and dirt.  There was only cold water to the bathroom basin.  Lots of noise, the one night we were here, until early hours of morning.
column9: It was close to Little India.  The building was colonial style.  The air conditioning worked.  It had a safe in the room.

column6: “It was located very near to the underground MRT Rochor...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Standard Double or Twin Room', '• Stayed 2 nights']
column8: Hotel ceiling wall was a bit thin as you can hear other guest walking upstairs (heavy footsteps).  Air cond was noisy and the small 2 feet by 2 feet shower area. There was no complimentary water bottle provided in the room since Singapore tap water is safe for drinking! Coffee and tea was not refill during housekeeping.
column9: It was located very near to the underground MRT Rochor station making travelling around Singapore a breeze. Only 2 MRT station away from Marina Bay sands which we loved. Breakfast was sufficient but no meat was served. They have different menu everyday. Front desk staffs were very helpful and courteous. Housekeeping was done every day whereby we get fresh towels.
